frameDefinitions: These are words relating to filling containers and covering areas with some thing, things or substance, the Theme.
The number of entities that make up the Set changes from an Initial_number to a Final_number.

This frame consists of words that indicate that an Agent or a Cause affects the position of an Item on some scale (the Attribute) to change it from an initial value (Value_1) to an end value (Value_2).
An Item changes its physical size.
The Invader enters a Land in an aggressive attempt to cripple or dominate its people and its government.
This frame consists of words that indicate the change of an Item's position on a scale (the Attribute) from a starting point (Initial_value) to an end point (Final_value).
frameExamples: Lionel Hutz <t>coated</t> the wall with paint.
How has the <t>proliferation</t> of cellular telephones affected your amateur mobile operation? INI INI
The company is <t>raising</t> the final dividend from 4.34p to 4.57p, to boost the total by 5.3 percent to 6.36p.
The pile of leaves had <t>shrunk</t> by about half after the first haul.
In August 1990 ,Iraq was <t>invading</t> Kuwait , which led to the Gulf war .
Hawke's Bay winery <t>doubled</t> in size last year.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> is the actor who instigates the filling.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the physical object or substance which changes location.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is the area or container being filled. Goal is generally the NP Object in this frame.
An event which brings about the filling of the <fen>Goal</fen>.
When the filling occurs.
Where the filling takes place.
The group of entities, possibly construed as a collective, whose number changes.
The number of entities by which the <fen>Set</fen> increases or decreases.
The number of entities in the <fen>Set</fen> afterwards.
The initial number of entities in the <fen>Set</fen>.
A description that presents the <fen>Set</fen>'s state before the change in the number of entities making it up as an independent predication.
A description that presents the <fen>Set</fen>'s state after  the change in the <fen>Attribute</fen>'s value as an independent predication.
The <fen>Time</fen> is the time-frame in which the change in number occurs.
A location where the <fen>Set</fen> changes in number.
The person who causes an entity (Item) to change its positon on a scale with respect to some property (Variable).
The scale along which the <fen>Item</fen> ranges in value.
The entity whose position along a scale is being changed.
The force that causes the change.
When the event occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> changes the value of an <fen>Attribute</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Item</fen> whose size changes.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the expansion occurs.
The political area that is being crippled by the <fen>Invader</fen>'s entry.
The army or other self-directed entity that is entering the <fen>Land</fen> in a hostile manner.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Invader</fen> invades <fen>Land</fen>.
This role identifies the location where the <fen>Invader</fen> invades the <fen>Land</fen>.
The <fen>Attribute</fen> is a scalar property that the <fen>Item</fen> possesses.
The entity that has a position on the scale.
The distance by which an <fen>Item</fen> changes its position on the scale.
The position on the scale where the <fen>Item</fen> ends up.
The initial position on the scale from which the <fen>Item</fen> moves away.
A portion of the scale, typically identified by its end points, along which the values of the <fen>Attribute</fen> fluctuate.
A description that presents the <fen>Item</fen>'s state before the change in the <fen>Attribute</fen>'s value as an independent predication.
A description that presents the <fen>Item</fen>'s state after  the change in the <fen>Attribute</fen>'s value as an independent predication.
The <fen>Time</fen> is the time-frame in which the change of position occurs.
A location where Attribute is measured
listRoleExamples: Rev. Lovejoy carefully brushed the rolls <fex>with butter</fex>.
<fex>The union's membership</fex> has dwindled from 1.5 million in 1979 to a little more than 600000 today.
Jaffna's student population has dwindled <fex>by more than a hundred</fex>.
Church of England baptisms have dwindled from 365000 in 1940 <fex>to 150000 in 1995</fex>.
The number of Medline searches has greatly proliferated <fex>from 7 million</fex> to 120 million.
The human population has dwindled <fex>from being world dominators</fex> to simple survivors.
Oh, my aching software: Worms and viruses proliferated <fex>in 2003</fex>.
They increased <fex>the price of oil</fex>.
<fex>Oil</fex> prices were raised yesterday.
<fex>The rain</fex> increased the river's flow rate to an astonishing million gallons per second.
As a result, they raised prices <fex>in Peoria</fex>.
<fex>Joan's new sweater</fex> shrank to a size that might fit a doll.
Henry II had made no attempt to invade <fex>France.</fex>
Indeed , three months later <fex>Hitler</fex> invaded Austria.
Oil rose <fex>in price</fex> by 2%.
I fear <fex>this service</fex> will diminish in quality.
Oil rose in price <fex>by 2%</fex>.
Microsoft shares fell <fex>to 7 5/8</fex>.
Microsoft shares fell <fex>from 12 3/8</fex> to 7 5/8.
The patient's temperature fluctuated <fex>between 28.5 and 29.5</fex>.
Diesels have increased <fex>from having a 20% market share in 1995</fex> to just over 30% in 2004.

It was never bad (1 or 2 seizures a year), but this past decade, it has increased
<fex>to having them 1 day a month</fex> and on that 1 day I have 6 or 7 seizures.
